column4: /proc is not a real filesystem, you aren't meant to create files there.
Also have tons of numbered folders in "/proc".  Wonder if there is a directory number limit?

from the manpage: The  proc filesystem is a pseudo-filesystem which is used as an interface to kernel data structures.  It is commonly mounted at /proc.  Most of it is  read-only,but some files allow kernel variables to be changed.
I highly advise not touching it.
